tasks.task: Wear extra protection when mixing and loading pesticides.
subtasks: Put on protective eyewear.
Use an apron over protective equipment.
Wear appropriate clothing (mention not specified in transcript, inferred based on context).
Place pesticide container on a low, flat surface.
Use a sharp knife or scissors to open the container (specifically avoiding ripping).
Wash knife or scissors with soap and water after use.
Only use the knife/scissors for opening pesticide containers.
Refer to the label for the correct amount.
Measure pesticide carefully (verb).
Pour liquids slowly and carefully to avoid splashes.
Keep face and eyes well above the container during pouring.
Take additional precautions (not specified, inferred from context, like maintaining balance or using aids if needed).

tasks.task: Wear extra protection when mixing and loading pesticides.
subtasks: Put on protective eyewear.
Use an apron over your protective equipment.

Put the pesticide container on a low, flat surface.
Use a sharp knife or scissors (use only for this purpose; wash afterwards).
Wash the knife or scissors with soap and water before and after use.
Only use the knife or scissors for opening pesticide containers.
Follow the label directions to find out how much pesticide is needed.
Measure the pesticide carefully.
Pour the pesticide slowly and carefully to avoid splashes.
Keep your face and eyes well above the container while pouring.

tasks.task: **Wear extra protection when mixing and loading pesticides.**
subtasks: Wear protective eyewear.
Use an apron over your protective equipment.
Ensure your clothing is appropriate for the task.
Place the pesticide container on a low, flat surface.
Use a sharp knife or scissors to open the container (preventing dust from escaping).
Wash the knife or scissors with soap and water after use.
Use the tool only for opening pesticide containers.
Follow the label instructions to determine the correct amount.
Measure the pesticide carefully to avoid oversights.
Pour the pesticide slowly and carefully to prevent splashes.
Keep your face and eyes well above the pesticide container during pouring.
